data.title: Good place for a quick, tasy lunch.
data.text: Chris' has really good poboys (the fried shrimp is my personal favorite), and the second best restaurant gumbo in too. Been eating there for years and have always had fast, friendly service.

data.title: The absolute BEST roast beef poboy!
data.text: We are so addicted to this place. The staff are down home and always friendly and the food is consistently delicious. We highly recommend the roast beef poboy and fries, and their gumbo is out of this world!

data.title: Cajun Experience
data.text: You won't go away hungry! Shrimp Po-boy is delicious and  so full, they spill over! Salads are fresh, crispy and you will probably want to share! Staff always friendly, and attentive.  Lunch is always busy, but if you get in early like I do at 11, I always have time  to read the paper.  Perfect place to be introduced to the Po-boy, bread is soft and fresh as well!

data.title: Traditional Po-Boy
data.text: This Lafayette standard has been a favorite "go to" lunch spot in Lafayette for years.  My favorite, the Chris' Special, is full of meat and their bread is very soft and light. The fried shrimp and catfish po-boys are also a popular item.  Definitely worth a try!

data.title: Great po'boys
data.text: My personal favorite in south La. Mouthwatering  roast beef po'boy, steak fries, all  with a cajun flare.

data.title: Not good
data.text: Skimpy sandwiches. This is not a po'boy. This is a skimpy sandwich on a bun. Tried several times and other locations but still a less than average experience.

data.title: Chris' Special
data.text: When you are hungry, try a Chris' Special po-boy! A half will get the job done, but a whole is nice even as a second meal.  Their gumbo is great all year round and comes in several sizes.

data.title: Great Fried Shrimp
data.text: We were in town for a softball showcase tournament and went here for a late lunch/early dinner between games.  We ordered a shrimp platter, shrimp po-boy and gumbo,  The gumbo was good but the fried shrimp and french fries were great.  The fried shrimp po-boy was very good.  It came with mayo and cabbage on it.  I added some cocktail sauce and thought it put it over the top.  My granddaughter wanted to go back and eat more shrimp after her last game before we left town the next day but they were closed on Sunday.  Would definitely recommend this place and would return again if we are ever back in the area.

data.title: First taste of authentic poboy
data.text: Nice spot, easy to reach with many parking lots. Great food and drink. We especially enjoyed the Cajun pork poboy and the home made ice tea. The waiter was very nice and we had a perfect service!!! Friendly and very honest ( recommending one entire sandwich instead of two half ones - price was worth it). Please just go there

data.title: Awesome! The place to go  for excellent Food!!!
data.text: Dee and Al here...I read reviews and trust them so ive decided to start returning the favor. My husband and I dont take the qualit y of our food lightly and we wont ever give a bogus review, if we say it you can trust it. This place has the best po- boys we've   tasted and we're not young, lol. I had  the roast beef w/gravy (lett & tom not cabbage) and he had the ham & amer cheese (hot) chk & saus. Gumbo was also great. The staff and hospitality was excellent!!!! We will stop by often!

data.title: Always Good!
data.text: I live in this area and Chris' Po-Boys never disappoints!  There are a few around town and they all are very good.

data.title: fresh, authentic po-boys
data.text: chicken and sausage gumbo available from cup to large bowl size.  Fresh, authentic po-boys with excellent bread and a wide selection of seafood or meat fillings.  Very reasonably priced seafood platters are also available.

data.title: Good Po-Boy's at Chris'
data.text: The Chris' special is my favorite. Ham & Roast Beef with plenty of gravy on soft Po-Boy bread. Excellent sandwich.

data.title: Disappointed
data.text: Stopped here for lunch based on the recommendation from a friend and Trip Advisor reviews.  I had a roast beef po boy which was good but not great.  My wife had a cup of gumbo which she said was the worst she ever had.  On spoonful and she was done with it.  She had some fried shrimp which were small.  Prices were high for the quantity and quality of food.  Silverware was not clean and we had to ask forl replacements.  Service was ok.  Won't be returning.

data.title: loved it
data.text: We stopped by for a bite to eat on a work trip. We both had po boys and they were amazing and huge, especially for the price. The service was great as well. Everyone was so friendly. Will go back next time we are in town

data.title: Chris' Special!!!!
data.text: Do yourself a favor, order the Chris' Special.  It will change your life!!!  You will probably need to change your shirt afterward...it's pretty messy.  But you will not care one bit after the first bite.  Oh, and just for grins, they have just about the best gumbo you will ever eat also.  And not the gross New Orleans gumbo.  The real deal Cajun gumbo.

data.title: Not cheap but very good
data.text:
After driving all day in miserable weather, I was looking for some place close to my hotel so I wouldn't have to go back out and drive around a strange city in the dark and rain. 

After reading the many favorable Tripadvisor reviews, I took the chance and drove less than a mile to Chris' and although the outward appearance was not quite what I anticipated I continued on inside to see more of the same.

However, the menu options more than made up for the first impression and I quickly found my two favorite items. I ordered half a shrimp poboy and a small bowl of seafood gumbo and bread pudding to the back to my hotel.

They were delicious! Shrimp was crispy and flavorful and the gumbo was superb. I've had better bread pudding though.

Was surprised at spending more than $20 for basically half a sandwich and soup but it was very good none the less.

data.title: Juicy Roast Beef Po Boys
data.text: I've been eating sandwiches from Chris' Po Boys since I moved to Lafayette in 1980.  I've moved away because of my job but always stopped at Chris' for the best roast beef po'boys I've every had....And I've had many over the years, but theirs is the best. I've moved back to Lafayette about 10 years ago and Chris' is a regular stop for po'boys I'd rank them up there with Mother's in New Orleans.  In fact, Mother's would have a hard time on a head to head competition!  And, when the weather gets cold, you have to try their gumbo.  Best in town!

data.title: Delicious Po-Boys!!
data.text: Chris's is a staple po-boy spot in Lafayette. Known for their delicious po-boys and they have amazing gumbo as well.

data.title: Gumbo
data.text:
Shrimp and Okra Gumbo at Chris' Po-Boys is the best in town!!! Only served on Monday Tuesday and Wednesday.
The following days of the week feature chicken and sausage Gumbo.   That's good too!!
